SENT.plain: An 85-year-old patient suffered from progressive deterioration (NYHA III) for several months
Echocardiography as well as a CT scan of the heart revealed a heart tumor to be the cause
After transvenous biopsy, the diagnosis of a Burkitt lymphoma could be established

Due to the advanced age of the patient, the intended surgical therapy was turned down and the patient was treated with 6 courses of a potentially therapeutic chemotherapy (CHOP scheme), which was well tolerated by the patient
The following CT scan showed a complete remission of the tumor
Six months after chemotherapy the patient is in NYHA stage I
